Class AbapCheckUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.util.abap.AbapCheckUtils

  • public abstract class AbapCheckUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for checks analyzing ABAP code.

    • Method Detail

      • isEntityWithinClassScope

        public static boolean isEntityWithinClassScope(ShallowEntity entity)
        Checks whether an entity is within the scope of a class.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to be checked.
        Returns:
        Yes if passed entity is within class scope, false otherwise.

      • isEntityWithinGlobalScope

        public static boolean isEntityWithinGlobalScope(ShallowEntity entity)
        Checks whether an entity is in global scope, i.e. is a child of a top entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to be checked.
        Returns:
        Yes if passed entity is global, false otherwise.

      • isEntityWithinLocalValidScope

        public static boolean isEntityWithinLocalValidScope(ShallowEntity entity)
        Checks whether an entity is within a valid, local scope. Valid local scopes are if the parent of the entity is e.g. a method, a form or a function. Invalid local scopes are if the parent is e.g. an IF statement.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if passed entity is within local, valid scope, false otherwise.

      • isIgnoredForDatabaseChecks

        public static boolean isIgnoredForDatabaseChecks(ShallowEntity entity,
                                                 java.util.List<ShallowEntity> rootEntities,
                                                 java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Disable check for inherited methods, since we cannot see their interface and hence cannot judge whether tables are passed as parameters or refer to the database. Also disable check for cases in which we cannot be sure we see all variables. This is true if
        • we have INCLUDEs in the code
        • we are inside a program include
        • we are inside a function group include
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to check. May be a database statement or a macro.
        rootEntities - The corresponding file's root entities.
        uniformPath - The uniformPath to that file.

      • isVariable

        public static boolean isVariable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                 ShallowEntity entity,
                                 ITypeResolution typeResolution)
        Whether the given table name is considered a variable with regards to its contents, length, and the current variable scope.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The table name inside an SQL statement.
        entity - The entity containing the SQL statement. This may be the SQL statement directly or a macro containing the statement.
        typeResolution - The type resolution. This typically comes directly from the check context.

      • getUnquotedTextForCharcterLiteral

        public static java.lang.String getUnquotedTextForCharcterLiteral(IToken token)
        Gets the text of an ABAP character literal token without single quotes.
        Returns:
        the unquoted literal text or null if token is not of type ETokenType.CHARACTER_LITERAL

      • isFunctionCallOfAny

        public static boolean isFunctionCallOfAny(ShallowEntity entity,
                                          java.lang.String... functionNames)
                                   throws CheckException
        Checks if the given entity is a function call of a function with any of the given names.
        Throws:
        CheckException

      • getNormalizedStartTokensText

        public static java.lang.String getNormalizedStartTokensText(ShallowEntity entity,
                                                            ICheckContext context)
                                                     throws CheckException
        Gets the normalized text of the start tokens of a ShallowEntity (typically for statement). Normalization is performed as follows:

        1) full comment lines (introduced with *) are removed

        2) mid-line comments (introduced with ") will be removed (unless a ' follows the " since it is assumed that the " is within a String literal in that case).

        3) white spaces before the closing . are removed

        4) all (sequences of) white spaces are replaced by a single space

        Throws:
        CheckException
